result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antonio Damon Harris

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Antonio Damon Harris in court, appeared by video with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont, appeared by video.  James C Griffin appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Antonio Damon Harris in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Antonio Damon Harris in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Antonio Damon Harris in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Antonio Damon Harris in court with Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 11CF1378. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer A. Milone. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Case remains calendared 4/28/2022 at 3pm for scheduling in Br. 2.

Defendant Antonio Damon Harris in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a projected guilty plea. Case also scheduled for preliminary hearing. Case adjourned.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Court orders defendant referred  to Justice Point for level 3 supervision with house arrest, release only for medical appointments and medical appointments. 
Court advised defendnat to attend all court proceedings.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant previously reviewed criminal complaint with defense counsel and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. For reasons stated, defense waives time limits for a preliminary hearing. Parties request a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom. Defendant Antonio Damon Harris in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Antonio Damon Harris in court with attorney .  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Court vacates bench warrant.  Status conference scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
At request of attorney Guimont, and with approval from the Court, case scheduled for return on warrant on 2/21/2022 at 8:30 am by Zoom.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
